questions.question_text:
A developer needs to save a List of existing Account records named myAccounts to the database, but the records do not contain Salesforce Id values. Only the value of a custom text field configured as an External ID with an API name of Foreign_Key__c is known.
Which two statements enable the developer to save the records to the database without an Id? (Choose two.)
Which standard field is required when creating a new Contact record?

An org has a data model with a Buyer__c object that has a lookup relationship to Region__c and a Supplier__c object has a lookup relationship to Region___c.
How can a developer display data from the related Supplier__c records on a Visualforce page that has a standard controller for the Buyer__c object?

discussion.content: I believe the answer is B.

1. There's no such thing as a rollup formula field.
2. A rollup Summary field can't be placed on lookups.
3. The answer is B.
For me is . Just use a merge field: Buyer__c.Region__c.Supplier__C.name

Selected Answer: B
B is the answer

Selected Answer: B
have to query for it

Selected Answer: B
Answer should be B only

choices.B: Use SOQL in a controller extension to query for related Supplier__c records.
choices.C: Use a second standard controller for the Region__c object on a page to display the related Supplier__c records.
choices.D: Use merge field syntax to retrieve the Supplier__c records related to the Buyer__c record through the Region__c.
choices.A: Use rollup formula fields on the Buyer__c object to reference the related Supplier__c records through the Region__c.

questions.question_text: What can be used to delete components from production?

discussion.content: package.xml has to be empty. C is correct.

Selected Answer: C
To delete components, use the same procedure as with deploying components, but also include a delete manifest file that’s named destructiveChanges.xml and list the components to delete in this manifest. The format of this manifest is the same as package.xml except that wildcards aren’t supported.

Selected Answer: C
destructiveChanges.xml lists the component you want to delete and package.xml lists components you want to add or update. So if you're not adding anything, then package xml should be empty.

Selected Answer: C
package must be an empty

comments.content: In your link is the package.xml file empty, so C is correct

choices.C: An ant migration tool deployment with a destructiveChanges XML file and an empty package.xml file
choices.A: A change set deployment with a destructiveChanges XML file
choices.B: A change set deployment with the delete option checked
choices.D: An ant migration tool deployment with a desctuctiveChanges XML file and the components to delete in the package.xml file
Type code into the Developer Console and execute it directly.
choices.E: Create and execute a test method that does not specify a runAs() call.
choices.B: Create a Visualforce page that uses a controller class that is declared without sharing.
choices.A: Use the SOAP API to make a call to execute anonymous code.
choices.C: Run code using the Anonymous Apex feature of the Developer's IDE.

questions.question_text: What are three techniques that a developer can use to invoke an anonymous block of code? (Choose three.)

comments.content: If Visual Studio Code is intended as the Developer's IDE, I agree. Also FYI here's a link about this: https://developer.salesforce.com/tools/vscode/en/apex/writing#:~:text=You%20can%20execute%20Anonymous%20Apex,entire%20context%20of%20a%20file.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ACD
ACD seem correct
